body: While many druids keep to the wilderness, some make their way within settlements, communing with the animals and vermin who live there and speaking for the nature that runs rampant in civilization's very cradle.
name: Urban Druid
url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid

sections.body: An urban druid can channel stored spell energy into domain spells that she has not prepared ahead of time. She can “lose” a prepared spell in order to cast any domain spell of the same level or lower. This ability replaces the ability to spontaneously cast summon nature's ally spells.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/Spontaneous Casting
sections.name: Spontaneous Casting

sections.body: An urban druid may not select an animal companion. Instead, she must choose from the following domains, rather than those usually available to druids: Charm, Community, Knowledge, Nobility, Protection, Repose, Rune, or Weather.
sections.name: Nature Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/Nature Bond

sections.body: At 2nd level, an urban druid adds Diplomacy, Knowledge (history), Knowledge (local), and Knowledge (nobility) skills to her list of class skills. She also receives a +2 bonus on these skill checks. This ability replaces a druid's woodland stride and trackless step abilities.
sections.name: Lorekeeper
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/Lorekeeper

sections.body: At 4th level, an urban druid gains a +2 bonus on saves vs. divinations and enchantments. This replaces the resist nature's lure ability.
sections.name: Resist Temptation
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/Resist Temptation

sections.body: An urban druid gains this ability at 6th level.
sections.name: A Thousand Faces
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/A Thousand Faces

sections.body: An urban druid gains this ability at 8th level, except that her effective druid level for the ability is equal to her druid level – 4.
sections.name: Wild Shape
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/Wild Shape

sections.body: At 9th level, an urban druid gains immunity to charm and compulsion effects. This ability replaces venom immunity.
sections.name: Mental Strength
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Druid/Druid Archetypes/Urban Druid/Mental Strength
